text: He was passing through a corridor and crossing a door he was passing through the same corridor again with some brief details that made him different. I thought the runner before me had a dream and this one was real. He would go back through a door and walk into another corridor with new details that distinguished him from the previous one and then he thought that this one was also a dream and this one was real. He then crossed new doors that led him to runners, each of whom was for him, at the time of his passage, the only existing one. He briefly ascended to the vigil and thought: This too may be a way to pray the rosary. FIN
title: Sueño del fraile
author: Álvaro Mutis
